articles.title: Six African countries to get own mRNA jab production
articles.description: Egypt, Kenya, Nigeria, Senegal, South Africa and Tunisia were selected as the first recipients of technology from the WHO#39;s global mRNA vaccine hub, in a push to ensure Africa can make its own jabs to fight the Covid and other diseases.
articles.content:
Six African countries have been chosen to establish their own mRNA vaccine production, the World Health Organization said Friday, with the continent largely shut out of access to Covid jabs.
